alert.note: Alert for Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 27 at 4:11PM EST until December 29 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... Meherrin River At Lawrenceville affecting Brunswick County. Nottoway River Near Stony Creek affecting Sussex County. For the Chowan Basin...including Rawlings, Stony Creek, Sebrell, Lawrenceville, Emporia, Franklin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING TO LATE FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nottoway River near Stony Creek. * WHEN...From Thursday evening to late Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding of lowlands begins in vicinity of the gage and downstream along VA Route 40. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 7.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to a crest of 15.3 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.4 feet on 08/11/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 700 AM EST.
